co.tinode.tinodesdk

Class Connection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.java_websocket.WebSocketAdapter
      • org.java_websocket.AbstractWebSocket
        • org.java_websocket.client.WebSocketClient
          • co.tinode.tinodesdk.Connection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, org.java_websocket.WebSocket, org.java_websocket.WebSocketListener

    public class Connection
extends org.java_websocket.client.WebSocketClient
    A thinly wrapped websocket connection.

      • Connection

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect(boolean autoReconnect,
                    boolean background)
        Establish a connection with the server. It opens or reopens a websocket in a separate thread. This is a non-blocking call.
        Parameters:
        autoReconnect - if connection is dropped, reconnect automatically

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Gracefully close websocket connection. The socket will attempt to send a frame to the server. The call is idempotent: if connection is already closed it does nothing.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Check if the socket is OPEN.
        Returns:
        true if the socket is OPEN, false otherwise;

      • isWaitingToReconnect

        public boolean isWaitingToReconnect()
        Check if the socket is waiting to reconnect.
        Returns:
        true if the socket is OPEN, false otherwise;

      • backoffReset

        public void backoffReset()
        Reset exponential backoff counter to zero. If autoreconnect is true and WsListener is provided, then WsListener.onConnect must call this method.

      • onOpen

        public void onOpen(org.java_websocket.handshake.ServerHandshake handshakeData)
        Specified by:
